articleTitle: Engineers & electrons: A century of electrical progress
Judging by the cover: Most job interviewers make quick judgments about an applicant, based on appearance; judgments that can affect an entire interview and get you the job
A modern power system simulation laboratory: A power system engineering lab should be a priority for universities updating their facilities. One is currently being built at Virginia Tech
Accreditation: What it means to you: ABET's evaluations of engineering programs guarantee your educational investment by ensuring minimum levels of competence

Genius, creativity and leadership: Studies indicate that creative productivity is the result of a combination of widely varying factors
Creative problem solving combining man and machine: Problem solving in the computer age must make use of the unique abilities of humans and machines
Speech applications created by a microcomputer: Discover the advantages of newly developed single-chip microcomputers for digital signal processing in speech applications

Ada: A new programming language: The Department of Defense developed an incredible new programming language and named it in honor of Ada Lovelace, the world's first programmer

An introduction to standard-cell VLSI design: Very large scale integration (VLSI) is becoming an important means of producing electronic circuits at low cost, on tight schedules, and with protection for proprietary designs

Robert A. Millikan: Father of modern physics: This Nobel Prize winner's investigations provided the impetus for the scientific changes that have taken place in this century

Underground phenomena imaging using electromagnetic geophysical tomography: Electromagnetic geophysical tomography is a new technique used to characterize prospective urban subways, locating tunnels and natural caverns, mapping fractures in rock, and in delineating groundwater pathways

Semiconductor lasers: A choice structure for lightwave communications
Patent strategies for inventors: What's the use of getting a patent? Do they protect inventors, or is there some other purpose? What if something is invented but not patented?

Lasers: The healing tool of the future: Fulfillment of their far-reaching potential depends on the work of physicians and engineers to understand laser-tissue interactions and develop new technologies
Campus interviews — “What do they want from me?” Approach on-campus interviews by considering what is right for you

Alternate power production technologies: The promise and the challenge: Near-term and long-term generation alternatives can contribute to our energy resource base, but technological and environmental problems remain
On becoming an engineer part III: Civic responsibility: Even at the pinnacle of your career, your task is not done. New challenges await you as a citizen engineer
Trigonometric identities using frequency domain techniques: With practice, it is easier to derive most trigonometric identities than it is to look them up
Personal financial planning: Develop a good financial plan for yourself at an early age and assure a secure future
Be safe, not sorry, when dealing with electricity: Conscientious attention to proper safety measures should become completely ingrained — Don't take unnecessary chances with your life
Electric power systems: The computer connection: Applications — Ranging from billing to payroll to system planning, design, and operation — Make the power industry the third largest user of computers

Job fit and creativity: “Our great mistake is to neglect the cultivation of those virtues that a person has … to try to exact from each person virtues he does not possess

A sensible approach to teaching mathematics: In many math courses, such as calculus, the majority are engineering students but the instructors, consciously or unconsciously, present the subject as if they were planning a career in pure mathematics
Student papers contest: Writing a good technical paper can get you a job and provide beneficial background for the future

Resume writing: A solid resume is the first step toward getting the job of your dreams
Reading up books: An introduction to laser literature: Laser technology will produce new discoveries and new challenges, providing fertile ground for the well-trained and the well-read

Laser technology: Theory and operating principles: Application of the principles of quantum electronics has yielded hundreds of lasers whose wavelengths span from the infrared to the X-ray region of the spectrum

Answering the call to IEEE leadership: Plan now to become involved in Institute activities that groom you for a future leadership role and enhance your engineering know-how

Reading up books: Computer communications networks: New technologies revolutionize computers
Reading up books: Discrete mathematics for computer science: Studying this branch of mathematics can provide you with a solid background for computer theory and applications
